sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's Thursday, the 21st of April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's good to have you with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: These are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has told his troops not to storm Ukraine's last stronghold in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Instead, he's ordered a blockade to make sure, in his words, that not even a fly comes through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron and his far-right competitor Marine Le Pen make their biggest push yet to sway undecided voters in a televised debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Israel's air force and Palestinian militants have traded fire across the Gaza Strip as violence escalates at the Holy Alaska Mosque site in Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered Russian forces to hold off from storming the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Bunkering 2,000 Ukrainian troops, the plant remains the hold-off centre, with Russian military having the plant completely encircled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Putin made the call in a rare public briefing since the invasion began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I consider the proposed storming of the industrial zone inappropriate and ordered to be cancelled. This is the case when we must think, we must always think but in this case all the more about preserving the life and health of our soldiers and officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There is no need to climb into these catacombs and climb underground through these industrial facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Block off this industrial area so that not even a fly can fly through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Mariupol has seen some of the most dramatic fighting of the war and the capture of the city would fighting of the war and the capture of the city would be of both strategic and symbolic importance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Four buses from Mariupol have reportedly made it to Kyiv meanwhile, with Ukrainian Prime Minister Irina Vereshchuk making more exhaustive calls to stop stalling evacuations. Borodyanka, some 50 kilometers away from the Ukrainian capital, is but a shadow of itself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It was one of the most heavily bombed towns in the region of Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some 50 bodies have been recovered from the rubble so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hundreds more are expected to be found.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In different parts of the town, bodies are also being exhumed from temporary graves nine people were buried in these fields next to a local hospital alexander's father is among the bodies headless there was shelling in the evening he told us that he would go and stop the Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He spoke Russian. He's from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And he went to stop the column.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He stood in front of the armoured vehicles and they just ran over him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Nadia lost her 34-year-old son Konstantin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He was a construction worker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He was walking home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It was on the 28th of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They shot him with an automatic gun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And he didn't lie down quickly enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It went through his chest and stomach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We buried him on the 15th of March because we couldn't do it sooner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He stayed at the morgue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The commander didn't allow us to bury him, so we buried him on the 15th of March here, in the garden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The head of the national police in the Kyiv region is unequivocal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think it is possible and necessary to talk about a genocide of the Ukrainian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: and necessary to talk about a genocide of the Ukrainian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's another example of war crimes of the Russian Federation when they shoot civilian people. These people were not military and not territorial defence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They were simply civilians and they were shot in the street.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is against all international conventions and international law which prohibits such acts against civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well, these are very difficult moments and it's happening every day. More than 1,000 civilians have been found so far in the region of Kyiv and the police say they're making such findings daily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So obviously the figures are going to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I'm Valerie Gouriat from Borodjanka for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The much-anticipated face-off between far-right candidate Marine Le Pen and French President Emmanuel Macron quickly delivered what French voters had been expecting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: You're not going to make the salaries, Mr. Le Pen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And you won't make the bonuses either, Mr. Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: No, but I am not saying that. I say I removed the changes on the employers' side, I removed the taxes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But you're trying to make the people believe that you are going to increase the salaries by 10%. I just say no, that's not true.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Marine Le Pen and Emmanuel Macron clashed on virtually every topic proposed in the last debate ahead of the second round of the presidential vote on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A testimony of their profoundly different visions for France and beyond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Europe is not all or nothing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It is not we take everything and say nothing or we take nothing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I want to stay in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I want to change it profoundly to effectively bring about a European alliance of nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Your project, when we put things back together brick by brick, is a product that does not speak of itself, but which consists of getting us out of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It has a name, it's called the Europe of Nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If it's not the European Union, you leave the European Union, Ms Le Pen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Sorry to tell you, you can't decide to paint your walls on your own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But when you live in shared housing, you can't just say one day to the next, it's not shared housing anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's just what you decide because your name is Miss Le Pen. And while many expected a déjà vu, others saw differences in their candidates five years on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: She's better than in 2017.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Then she delivered a harsh performance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: She was on the defensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today one can see she has matured, she reflects on her ideas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: She speaks to the people, she thinks of the people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: She thinks of the French and in priority of the French. All the contrary of what was done by Emmanuel Macron over the last five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Purchasing power is currently the number one concern of French voters who, according to volunteers, are struggling struggling despite positive indicators, which could explain the subdued levels of interest in this race for president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People who live in precarious situations think above all of what they will eat, what they have at home, their purchasing power for tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The worry now is over obtaining oil, flour, sugar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's the main thing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Both candidates have been trying to rally their camps and beyond by promising concrete changes in people's lives over the next five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, France will know which path its citizens will tread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But many here remain skeptical over who will be responsible for footing the bill of those changes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There's a phrase in Provençal that says, which means, who will pay?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Miss Le Pen will propose something and we will have to go to the cashier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So in any case, someone will pay. Who? Us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges in Marseille, southern France, for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Israeli forces have responded to Palestinian militants firing volleys of rockets from Gaza

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: towards Israel with airstrikes. It's the biggest escalation since last year's 11-day war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Far-right Israeli lawmaker Itamar Ben-Gavir also took part in a march in Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is despite Prime Minister Naftali Bennett barring him from entering Muslim areas of Jerusalem's Old City and holding a rally as the Prime Minister tried to stem further violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Police in Jerusalem blocked roads in an attempt to prevent the march by ultra-nationalist Israelis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After some pushing and shoving, the marchers rallied near barricades that were put in place, waving flags, singing and chanting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A similar event nearly a year ago triggered an Israeli-Gaza war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's confrontation is the fifth this month. Far-right Israeli groups had announced plans to storm the Al-Aqsa in large numbers to mark Passover festivities this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: over festivities this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. We'll have plenty more after the break.
